variable.name: SUBJID
variable.description: Deidentified Subject's ID

variable.name: ENROLLMENT_AGE
variable.description: Age at Enrollment in DNA biorepository
variable.comment: For most patients, this will be the age at which DNA was collected.

variable.name: SEX
variable.description: Gender
variable.comment: External variable resource: caDSR; enter source ID: 2200604 (Public ID). NOTE: The codes from NCI Thesaurus are based on the Version 10.07d (July 26, 2010). The source files can be accessed from: http://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/NCI_Thesaurus. For NU subjects, from question 2 on the NUgene questionnaire.

variable.name: YEAR_BIRTH
variable.description: Year of birth
variable.comment: Group patients >89 years of age into one decile. For NU subjects, from question 1 on the NUgene questionnaire.

variable.name: DECADE_BIRTH
variable.description: Decade of birth
variable.comment: Group patients born prior to 1920 (>=89 years of age) into one group. For NU subjects, calculated from question 1 on the NUgene questionnaire.

variable.name: RACE
variable.description: Subject's race
variable.comment: External variable resource: caDSR; enter source ID: 106 (Public ID). NOTE: The codes from NCI Thesaurus are based on the Version 10.07d (July 26, 2010). The source files can be accessed from: http://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/NCI_Thesaurus. For NU subjects, derived from the ethnic questions on the NUgene questionnaire (question 14 on older version and question 18 on newer version), supplemented with EMR data where not reported on the NUgene questionnaire.

variable.name: ETHNICITY
variable.description: Is Subject Hispanic/Latino?
variable.comment: External variable resource: caDSR; enter source ID: 2002440 (Public ID). NOTE: The codes from NCI Thesaurus are based on the Version 10.07d (July 26, 2010). The source files can be accessed from: http://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/NCI_Thesaurus. For NU subjects, derived from NUgene questionnaire (question 14 on older version and question 19 on newer version) and EMR data.

variable.name: SMOKING_STATUS
variable.description: Last known Smoking status
variable.comment: External variable resource: caDSR; enter source ID: 2183382 (Public ID). NOTE: The codes from NCI Thesaurus are based on the Version 10.07d (July 26, 2010). The source files can be accessed from: http://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/NCI_Thesaurus. For NU subjects, derived from NUgene questionnaire (question 8 on older version and question 9 on newer version), and EMR data to get the latest known status.

variable.name: CASE_CONTROL
variable.description: T2DM Case or Control

variable.name: AGE_TYPE_2_DIABETES_ONSET
variable.description: Patient's age at the earliest indication of T2DM
variable.comment: Type_2_Diabetes_Age = (earliest year indication of T2DM - birth_year). Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: DIABETES_FAMILY_HISTORY
variable.description: Family History of Diabetes
variable.comment: Yes if any family members have had diabetes, type 1 or 2. For NU subjects, NUgene questionnaire (question 20 on older version and question 24 on newer version, diabetes conditions), and EMR data were combined to ascertain a more complete family history.

variable.name: Any_Abnormal_Glycosylated_Hemoglobin_Indicator
variable.description: Were Any (glycosylated) Hemoglobin (A1c) Lab values Abnormal
variable.comment: Glycosylated Hemoglobin Lab value is treated as abnormal if lab value does not fall within the expected normal range (usu. 4.5 - 6.1). If unknown or missing, assume not assessed.

variable.name: Any_Abnormal_Glucose_Indicator
variable.description: Were Any (random or fasting) Glucose Lab values Abnormal?
variable.comment: Glucose Lab value is treated as abnormal if lab value does not fall within the expected normal range (usu. 65-110). If unknown or missing, assume not assessed.

variable.name: Any_diabetes_diagnosis_code_indicator
variable.description: Were any diabetes diagnosis codes given (ICD-9 codes 250.xx, where x is any digit)?

variable.name: Age_first_type1_diabetes_diagnosis_code
variable.description: Age when first known type 1 diabetes diagnosis code was given (ICD-9 codes 250.x1 or 250.x3, where x is any digit)
variable.comment: Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: Age_first_type2_diabetes_diagnosis_code
variable.comment: Please note 250.10 and 250.12 are purposely left out, they are not used to determine type 2 diabetes for this study. Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: Age_last_known_type1_diabetes_diagnosis_code
variable.description: Age when last known type 1 diabetes diagnosis code was given (ICD-9 codes 250.x1 or 250.x3, where x is any digit)
variable.comment: Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: Age_last_known_type2_diabetes_diagnosis_code
variable.comment: Please note 250.10 and 250.12 are purposely left out, they are not used to determine type 2 diabetes for this study. Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: Any_diabetes_drug_prescribed_indicator
variable.description: Were any diabetes drugs (Sulfonylureas, Meglitinides, Biguanides, Thiazoldinediones, Alpha-glucosidase inhibitors, DPPIV inhibitor (sitagliptin), exenatide, insulin, Symlin, or any diabetic supply including insulin needles and glucose monitors) prescribed

variable.name: Age_first_type1_diabetes_drug_prescribed
variable.description: Age when first known type 1 diabetes drug (insulin, Symlin, or any insulin supply) prescribed
variable.comment: Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: Age_first_type2_diabetes_drug_prescribed
variable.description: Age when first known type 2 diabetes drug (in the following classes: Sulfonylureas, Meglitinides, Biguanides, Thiazoldinediones, Alpha-glucosidase inhibitors, DPPIV inhibitor (sitagliptin), or the injectable exenatide) prescribed
variable.comment: Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: Age_last_known_type1_diabetes_drug_prescribed
variable.description: Age when last known type 1 diabetes drug (insulin, Symlin, or any insulin supply) prescribed
variable.comment: Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: Age_last_known_type2_diabetes_drug_prescribed
variable.description: Age when last known type 2 diabetes drug (in the following classes: Sulfonylureas, Meglitinides, Biguanides, Thiazoldinediones, Alpha-glucosidase inhibitors, DPPIV inhibitor (sitagliptin), or the injectable exenatide) prescribed
variable.comment: Code patients >89 years of age as 90.

variable.name: Number_in_person_clinician_encounters
variable.description: Number of in-person encounters the patient has had with a clinician as recorded in the EMR, as evidenced by problem or medication list or history entries/updates, or other evidence specific to each site's EMR
variable.comment: Code patients with >=1000 encounters as 999.

variable.name: HYPERTENSION
variable.description: Hypertension status
variable.comment: Repeatedly (on >1 date) elevated blood pressure exceeding 140 over 90 mmHg, and/or ICD-9 code 401.*, 402.*, 403.*, 404.* External variable resource: caDSR; enter source ID: 2183378 (Public ID). NOTE: The codes from NCI Thesaurus are based on the Version 10.07d (July 26, 2010). The source files can be accessed from: http://evs.nci.nih.gov/ftp1/NCI_Thesaurus.

variable.name: Body_Mass_Index_average
variable.description: Average Body Mass Index of participant, see comments for how average calculated
variable.comment: 1. Non-pregnant BMI (do not include BMIs during pregnancy or 9 months after pregnancy). 2. Imputed BMI based on +/-6 months time period. If the subject is a 'case' we used the average of BMI records for observation ages closest to the T2D age of onset. If the subject is a 'control' we use the average of BMI observations for the last age on record. For NU subjects, EMR data was combined with NUgene questionnaire data (questions 5, 6 on older version and questions 5-7 on newer version) to calculate BMI.
